Lytta ( Lytta ) choui
Wang, Wang et Ren, 2012a: 376
.
Type locality: “ Mt. Xiaowutai , Hebei , China ”
. Type depository: MHBU.
syn. nov.

Distribution. China : Beijing , Guangxi , Guizhou (new record), Hebei , Heilongjiang , Inner Mongolia , Jilin , Liaoning , Ningxia , Qinghai , Shaanxi , Shandong , Shanxi , Xinjiang ; Japan , Korea , Russia , Tajikistan .

Remarks.
Wang et al . (2012a)
suggested that
Lytta choui
is similar to
L. suturella ( Motschulsky, 1860 )
, but can be distinguished by the following characters: “head with a rhombic orange spot on frontal; bearing two protibial spurs, the inner one long and stout, the outer one shorter and thin; 8th tergum sharply angulate on margin; the hollow of the front margin of prothorax shallow; median lobe with a well-developed ventral spine”. We examined the type of
L. choui
and other specimens from Mt. Xiaowutai (the type locality of
L. choui
) identified as
L. suturella
, and conclude that the above features do not support
L. choui
as a valid species. Therefore,
L. choui
is synonymized with
L. suturella
.
